Desde hace aproximadamente 5 meses quiso volver a abrir su tienda general, pero debido a la falta de capital en el momento no puede ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos. Es por esto que ahora Luz Margarita busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para así surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas considerablemente.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo poco a poco y retomará el gran negocio que tenía antes, de modo que su familia podrá seguir gozando de una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luz Margarita is a hardworking person who has had to overcome great adversities in her life along with her husband, who has been instrumental in offering a good quality of life for their two children. Approximately seven years ago, Luz Margarita opened a general store so that she could contribute financially toward the household expenses since her husband's salary was insufficient. However, she was obligated to close her store about a year ago because of family difficulties. From that point she experienced major challenges.

Luz Margarita reopened her store five months ago, but she lacks the capital to offer her customers a wide variety of products. For this reason, she is now seeking the opportunity to access a loan so that she can buy household products to restock her store and provide her customers with a greater variety of products. This will increase her sales considerably. As a result, her store will continue to grow gradually and return to the successful business that it once was. Her family will also enjoy a good quality of life and greater financial opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy household products for her store.

loans.name: Angel Rutilio

texts.es:
Don Ángel cuenta con una edad de 46 años, el vive con su familia en una aldea al sur de Honduras, su negocio es un taller de mecánica en el cual también el vende repuestos y lubricantes como ser: llantas para vehículo y para motocicletas, aceite, stop, bujías, parabrisas etc. 
Don Ángel esta solicitando un  préstamo de 15,000.00 lempiras para poder aumentar el inventario de su negocio con llantas, aceites, lubricantes, filtros, bujías, parabrisas, focos, empaques, fricciones y otros repuestos y así podrá vender mas ya que la demanda de la mercadería cada día es mayor.
El sueño de Don Ángel es  que la venta de su negocio sea mayor para así su vida económica pueda mejorar y de esa manera seguir remodelando  su vivienda para darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Ángel is 46 years old and lives with his family in a village in southern Honduras. His business is an auto repair shop, where he also sells spare parts and lubricants, such as: vehicle and motorcycle tires, oil, brake lights, spark plugs, windshields, etc. 
Ángel is requesting a 15,000.00 lempira loan in order to increase inventory for his business with tires, oils, lubricants, filters, spark plugs, windshields, headlights, gaskets, brake shoes, and other spare parts. This way he will be able to make more sales, since demand for his merchandise is greater every day.
Ángel's dream is to increase sales in his business so that his financial life may improve. This will allow him to continue remodeling his home and provide his family with better living conditions.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase tires, oils, lubricants, filters, spark plugs, windshields, headlights, gaskets, brake shoes, and other spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Kiriana

texts.en:
Kiriana has a business raising and selling animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She buys the animals when they are young and fattens them for about three months before selling them. Recently, Kiriana has been making improvements to her house. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase roofing tiles to finish the construction.

Kiriana is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo," located in the Southern Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy roofing tiles for her house

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa is a 34-year-old married lady who lives with her spouse, daughter and parents in a small apartment in the city of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. 

After graduating from sales worker’s training in 2009 she started supporting her family by operating a grocery store business in a local busy district.  

But because of city construction work her small store moved to another place, so she needs a variety of food products. So Ariunaa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Petra Astolfa

texts.es:
Petra tiene 49 años de edad nació en Quevedo. Está casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. 
Hace 20 años se mudo a Guayaquil con el fin de mejorar su estilo de vida. Empezó su negocio por necesidad, su esposo no tiene trabajo fijo, su actividad es hacer fletes en triciclo lo cual no genera mucho dinero. Se decidió a vender colas y agua por que la habían operado de la vejiga y no podía hacer fuerza de esa manera contribuye en la casa. Realiza su trabajo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche con la ayuda de su esposo ya que con el triciclo es más fácil transportar la mercadería. Por ahora no tiene ningún tipo de dificultad aunque si le preocupa su salud. Sus hijos como son mayores de edad (19 y 23 años) trabajan y también ayudan en la economía del hogar. Con el préstamo va a comprar colas y bebidas para aumentar las ventas. Su meta futura es terminar su vivienda ya que le falta adecuar un cuarto y cambiar el techo.
texts.en:
Petra is 49 years old and was born in Quevedo. She is married and has two grown children. Twenty years ago, she moved to Guayaquil in hopes of a better way of life. She started her business out of necessity. Her husband did not have steady work as a tricycle driver, so he did not earn much money. Petra decided to sell colas and water from home since she just had a bladder operation and did not have the strength to leave her house. She works from 7am to 9pm with the help of her husband. Since he drives a tricycle, it is easy to transport her merchandise. Petra does not face any difficulties at the moment, but she is still concerned about her health. Her adult children (ages 19 and 23) work and also help with the household finances.

Petra will use her loan to buy colas and beverages to increase her sales. Her goal for the future is to finish her home renovations, such as remodeling a room and replacing the roof.

loans.use: to buy colas and water.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s restaurant business. In the restaurant, he sells Punjabi food items called nan chanay (made with chick-peas and served with bread) and daal chawal (made with lentils and served with rice and pickle). These two dishes are very famous among people and they love to eat these dishes. 
 
With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, chick-peas, rice, etc., in larger quantities to make better quality food and larger quantities of food for his clients. This will help him improve his income. Perveen is confident that her husband will be able to earn more profits from his business after investing the loan. 

She is also a working lady and sells vegetables from her home. She charges very reasonable rates and offers fresh seasonal vegetables to her customers. 

She has given birth to a daughter who is 13 years old and helps her with her household responsibilities. Perveen is confident about her family’s bright future as a result of loan investment into her husband’s business.

Note: One of the members has a sewing business; that is why she is showing it in the picture.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es: María es soltera tiene 35. Nació en Saquisilí que es cantón de La Mana. El alegre pueblo de Saquisilí brinda una variedad exquisita de artesanías y vivencias en sus mercados que toman vida en ocho coloridas plazas, cada una de las cuales provee diferente mercadería e interesantes objetos de las comunidades indígenas de la región. Sus ferias son los días jueves las cuales congregan a los indígenas de los alrededores con sus productos agrícolas y artesanales. María nos cuenta que aprendió a los 8 años ya que la venta de legumbres es un negocio familiar. Actualmente trabaja sola desde las 7 am hasta las 19 pm. Con el crédito desea comprar sacos de cebollas, papas, choclos etc., para aumentar sus ventas. Su meta es comprar un terreno hacer una casa para alquilarla.
texts.en:
María is single. She is 35. She was born in Saquisilí, which is in the canton of La Mana. The lively town of Saquisilí offers an exquisite variety of handicrafts and experiences in its markets, which come to life at eight colorful public squares. Each one provides different merchandise and interesting objects from the indigenous communities in the region. On Thursdays there is a fair, where natives congregate from the surrounding areas with their agricultural products and handicrafts. 
María says she learned when she was eight years old, since selling legumes is a family business. She currently works alone from 7 AM to 7 PM.
She wants to use the loan to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes, ears of corn, etc. so that she may increase her sales.
Her goal is to purchase a piece of land and build a house so that she may rent it.

loans.use: to purchase onions, potatoes, ears of corn.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Chernor.  He is married and has 3 children aged 13, 8, and 5. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him because they are still at school. In 2007, Chernor established his grocery store. He began his business to enable him to live an independent life and it is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy sardines, mayonnaise, batteries and black mint. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Chernor plans to develop the plot of land he has purchased, to own a car and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted shop items

loans.name: Jhony Yonary

texts.es: El joven Jhony tiene 24 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Jhony se dedica al cultivo del café quien aprendió el oficio desde que era un niño ya que trabajaba en conjunto con su padre, hace 5 años el inicio a cultivar su propia finca en el cual el trabajo lo realiza a diario y no tiene horario de entrada ni salida. Por otra parte, una de las ventajas de Jhony es que su propiedad se encuentra en una zona muy apta para el cultivo y por lo tanto la producción del Café se da muy bien, por este motivo él se atrevió a solicitar este préstamo ya que necesita comprar fertilizante y completar el pago de mano de obra, y así darle un mejor y adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo. Uno de los inconvenientes que enfrenta Jhony es la poca mano de obra disponible y el tener que trasladar su producto ya que la cosecha es en temporada de invierno y las calles se ponen en mal estado. Su meta es poco a poco ir tecnificando su finca y que esta le genere mayores ganancias. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y piensa invertir muy bien el dinero para luego pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Jhony is a young man who is 24 years of age. He is married and has no children. His wife takes care of the household chores. Jhony is a coffee farmer who learned this trade as a boy by working alongside his parents. Five years ago, he started growing crops on his own farm where he works every day. He does not have a set schedule of when he stops and starts. One of the advantages that Jhony enjoys is that his property is in an area that is suitable for producing coffee. As a result, he has done very well.

Jhony initiated a loan request because he needs to buy fertilizers and complete the payment of his workers. This will enable him to do a better job of maintaining his crops. One of the inconveniences that Jhony must contend with is the lack of available workers. When he has to transport his product during the winter season, the roads during that time are in bad condition. His goal is to gradually modernize his farm so that he can generate more revenue. This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he plans to invest the money well and submit his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a secondary school in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 9,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy or invest in things that their salaries alone do not allow. At the end of each month, these teachers repay SMT/Kiva lenders from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the salary deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Aiah, who is pictured on the left, is the leader of this group. Aiah is fifty-five years old. He is a native of Kaima, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple has four children together who are attending primary and secondary schools. Aiah has been in the teaching profession for twenty years now. He wants this loan for two main reasons. First, to pay school fees for his children and second, to buy building materials like cement and corrugated iron sheets for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy building materials like cement and corrugated iron sheets for the construction of a house

loans.name: Yolanda Eulalia

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 54 años de edad es divorciada. Vive en Guayaquil, tiene 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad (36, 33 y 19 años). A los 20 años renuncio a la empresa donde laboraba por que padece de un problema en los riñones, aprendió y se dedico a la costura. Es independiente trabajando todo el día, no tiene ayudantes porque no le podría pagar un sueldo. Con el préstamo va a adquirir telas, hilos y cierres para aumentar sus ventas. En un futuro inmediato le gustaría adecuar su taller de modas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and divorced. She lives in Guayaquil and has three grown children (ages 36, 33, and 19). Twenty years ago, she quit her job as a seamstress at the company where she worked because of a problem with her kidneys. Yolanda is now independent and works every day. Since she has no assistants, she does not have to worry about payroll.

Her loan will be used to acquire fabrics, thread, and zippers so that she can increase her sales. In the immediate future, she would like to equip her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and zippers.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila will utilize the loan for her husband’s business of dairy and livestock. With the loan investment, her husband will buy a buffalo that will help him get larger quantities of milk for sale.
He is very experienced in his work and has been operating it for many years. Jamila is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve after investing the loan funds. She provides full support to her husband and takes care of the cattle in his absence. 
She is a very hardworking lady and also performs her household duties very well.  She has given birth to 6 children. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t provide them education. 
She is confident about her husband’s business success as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy & livestock business

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is 59 years old, married and has two children one of whom works.

Since 2005, Raed has owned an office for photocopying and typing. He has sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a photocopier and an electrical generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier and an electrical generator.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is 32 years old. He is from a small village of Ninotsminda District in the southern part of the country. Sergey lives with his wife (Erine), one-year-old daughter, mother and grandmother. Erine is a housewife. Sergey runs his family's dairy farm, which has three milk cows. Sergey produces cheese and sells it in the village to local dairy product retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 laris, including the monthly pension of Sergey’s grandmother. 

Sergey requested a loan for the expansion of the family dairy farm. He will use it to purchase two additional milk cows. With five milk cows Sergey will be able to produce 60% more cheese and increase the income of the family by at least 300 laris per month. He will use this increased income for creating better living conditions for his family members, especially for his little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Edilma Clemencia

texts.es: Edilama tiene 33 años, nació en Manabí. Actualmente vive en Quevedo con sus hijos. No es casada pero convive con el padre de sus hijos quien es chofer, tres de sus hijos estudian en escuela fiscal el cuarto es mayor de edad e independiente. El negocio se lo enseñaron sus hermanos que son comerciantes de frutas de esta manera ayuda en la economía de su hogar, también vende helados y pollos. Su horario de trabajo empieza a los 5 de am lo realiza sola pero cuando necesita ayuda para la estiva de las frutas contrata a otra persona. Por el momento no ha tenido problemas en su negocio ya que es conocida. El crédito lo va a emplear en la compra de frutas, pollo. Le gustaría en un futuro comprar un carro para su negocio y así brindarles mejor estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edilma is 33 years old and was born in Manabí. She currently lives in Quevedo with her children. She is not married, but lives with the father of her children, who is a driver. Three of her children go to public school. The fourth is an adult and lives independently.
She learned the business from her siblings, who are fruit merchants. This allows her to contribute to the household income. She also sells ice cream and chickens. Her work schedule starts at 5 AM. She works alone but when she needs help to load the fruit she hires another person. So far she has not had any problems with her business, since she is well known. 
She is going to use the loan to purchase fruit and chicken. In the future she would like to purchase a car for her business, so that she may provide greater financial stability for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Jlal

texts.en: Jlal is 35 years old and married. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store for two years. His educational background is a bachelor's degree. At first, he sold some land in order to open his business. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income, he sells grocery items. To increase his profit income, he took out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy eggs, biscuits, soap, etc. for his business. He thinks with this loan, he has been able to improve his living standards and he hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, biscuits, soap, etc for his business

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, married and has three children.

Israa has been a tailor since 2009. She makes, repairs, and alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats and trousers for women and children. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting $1,700 loan to purchase a tailoring machine and an electrical generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring machine and an electrical generator.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and has four children.

Salam has owned a shop since 1995, selling and changing oil for cars. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Shaef

texts.en: Shaef, 49, is married and has six children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He has a grocery store where he sells consumer staples to his clients. He started his business with money from his mother. Shaef will use the loan to buy products to stock his store such as sweets, soft drinks and groceries. In this way, he can increase his working capital. The reason he is requesting this loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items like soaps, candies, biscuits, etc for his business is because he doesn't have enough money to buy everything that he needs. He faces challenges with his business such as the competition. He will use the profits to purchase a lot more merchandise so that he can continue to keep his store well stocked. His dream for his business is to have a stable and profitable business. He is grateful for the opportunity that is being provided with this loan

loans.use: to buy grocery items like soap, candies, biscuits, etc for his business

loans.name: Moath

texts.en: Moath is 35 years old, married and has six children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He is a very hard working, modest young man. Above all, he is very optimistic. He has been operating a grocery store for four years. With much effort, and especially through saving, he managed to start his business by having an amount that enabled him to open his business. His goal is to increase his capital and get more profit, so he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items like candies, juices, mineral water and other items.  He believes that his business is doing well because he has a lot of faith in God. This is why he has work. This way he will be able to improve his income and improve the quality of life for his family. This way he will keep struggling every day to succeed and to realize his greatest dream, which is "To have his own house.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like candies, juices, mineral water and other items for his business

loans.name: Victoria K.

texts.en: Victoria lives in the Airport community. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 1 and 12. The children live at home and one attends school.  Victoria's husband is a businessman. For the past ten years, Victoria has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima, 60 years old, is a married woman. Her husband is a personal chef.
 
Although she is an old woman, Rima has recently started a small trading business buying and selling blankets mainly to neighbors and friends. Rima has found an unexpected joy in doing this business. For that reason, she has decided to expand and sell clothes too, so she has applied for this loan in order to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a mother of two children, ages 1 and 7. She is a farmer with three years of experience in mixed farming. Her major products are maize, milk, and beans which she sells in the local market to meet her family's needs.

Lilian has made a request for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets and venture into the pig farming business. She hopes this business will help her improve the standard of living of her two children.

She says lack of adequate water, pests, and animal diseases remain the challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Carlos Agusto

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos de 33 años de edad, es soltero, el vive con sus hermanos y demás familiares en un barrio en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace unos cuatro años  a la  venta de agua en botes este producto lo acarrea en una carreta  alada por caballo, y además tiene un molino en su casa en donde muele maíz a sus vecinos y amigos que le visitan todo los días por la mañana y tarde.
Carlos esta solicitando 16,000.00 lempiras para la compra de ropa nueva, como ser pantalones, camisas, sandalias para vender y algunos repuestos para el molino, con el préstamo Carlos pretende salir adelante en su negocio ya que con más ingresos sus posibilidades de tener una mejor vida son mayores.
Carlos entre sus sueños esta mejorar la casa donde vive y comprarse otro molino.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is 33 years old, single, and lives with his siblings and other family members in a neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras. For the past four years, he has been selling bottled water that he transports using a horse-drawn cart. He also owns a grain mill in his home for processing corn for his neighbors and friends who visit him every morning and afternoon.

Carlos is requesting 16,000 HNL so that he can buy new clothing such as trousers, shirts, and sandals to sell. He will also buy a few parts for his grain mill. With this loan, Carlos intends to move forward in his business. By generating more income, he will improve his possibilities for having a better life. His dreams are to make improvements to his house and to purchase another grain mill.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his grain mill and new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Olga Monserrate

texts.es: Olga nació en Santa Ana. Vive en Portoviejo desde que tenía 5 años. A sus 63 años de edad le gusta mucho estar activa. Vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Nos cuenta que le gusta mucho las familias numerosas por ese motivo tuvo 8 hijos. En la actualidad casi todos son casados y tienen familia propia. Tiene una tienda en su casa en la que vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, colas, azúcar etc., también se ayuda con la venta de galletas de coco que prepara desde hace mucho tiempo. Olga administra sola la tienda mientras su esposo recorre la cuidad vendiendo las galletas en fundas a un costo de 0.25 ctv., trabaja solo en las mañanas. Como toda la costa  la temporada invernal es un poco dura por las lluvias ya que el lodo dificulta la movilización.  Con el crédito incrementara su inventario comprando arroz, azúcar, harina, colas etc. En un futuro le gustaría reabrir la panadería y arreglar un poco su casa.
texts.en:
Olga was born in Santa Ana, and has been living in Portoviejo since she was 5 years old. At 63 years old, she loves to be active. Olga lives with her husband and one of their sons. She tells us that she loves big families, and therefore had 8 children. At present, almost all are married and have families of their own. 

Olga has a store in her house that sells staples like rice, glue, sugar etc. She also sells coconut cookies that she has been preparing for a long time. Olga manages the store alone while her husband travels around the city selling bags of cookies at a cost of 0.25 ctv, working only in the mornings. In winter, the whole coast is a hit hard by the rains and the mud makes it difficult to travel. With this loan, Olga will increase her inventory by buying rice, sugar, flour, glue etc. In future she would like to reopen her bakery and fix up her home a little.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, coconut cookies.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 42 años. Hace más de 20 años vive en Guayaquil, nació en Chimborazo se mudo para mejorar su economía. Está casado con Micaela con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 25 años de edad. Su esposa Amelia es ama de casa, actualmente solo vive uno de sus hijos con ellos. Su tienda la abrió hace muchos años, ya que su familia siempre a vivido del comercio y aprendió desde temprana edad. En la actualidad tiene una tienda que el administra y cuando puede su esposa lo ayuda. Su mayor preocupación es la temporada de invierno por las inundaciones que dañan sus productos. Con el préstamo piensa comprar más productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, colas, leche, queso, víveres, agua etc. Su mera es aumentar su negocio y mantenerse en buen estado de salud.
texts.en:
Antonio is 42 years old. He was born in Chimborazo and moved to Guayaquil to improve his economic position, and has been living there for over 20 years. He is married to Micaela, with whom he has 2 children aged 18 and 25. His wife is a housewife, and currently only one of his sons lives with them. Antonio opened his shop many years ago, as his family always learned the trade from an early age. 

Antonio currently has a store that he manages, and his wife helps out when she can. His biggest concern is the winter season because of floods that damage his products. With this loan, he plans to buy more products like rice, sugar, oil, glue, milk, cheese, food, water etc. His goal is to expand his business and remain in good health.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour and provisions for his store.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, 47 years old, is a married woman. 

Hanan has owned a tailoring workshop for nine years now. During this time, she was able to buy a new sewing machine and expand the business. Now Hanan wants to expand further so she is looking to recruit female tailors to help them improve their lives.  For that reason, she has applied for this loan to buy new sewing machines and prepare for the new tailors.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es casado tiene 3 hijos. Tiene 42 años y nació en Esmeraldas. Actualmente vive en Guayaquil aunque extraña su ciudad natal sobre todo la música y deliciosos cócteles que hipnotizan a los visitantes. Su esposa Nelva es empleada domestica, también vende productos por catalogo. Sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio en sus ratos libres. La crianza y venta de pollos lo inicio por que le genera más ganancias y tiempo de pasar con su familia. Trabaja todos los días alimentando a las aves en su propio criadero. Su mayor preocupación es el invierno que los animales necesitan de mayor  cuidado. Este es su quinto préstamo y desea comprar más pollos para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es comprar una casa en un sector más tranquilo ya que teme que sus hijos puedan ser influenciados por la delincuencia.
texts.en:
42-year-old Carlos is married with 3 children, and was born in Esmeraldas. He currently lives in Guayaquil but misses his hometown, especially the music and delicious cocktails that mesmerize visitors. His wife Nelva is a maid, and also sells products through catalogs. Their children help with her business in her spare time. 

Carlos started raising and selling chickens at home to generate more income and spend more time with his family. He works every day to feed the birds in their hatchery. His biggest concern is that during the winter, the animals need more care. This is his fifth loan, and he wishes to buy more chickens to expand his business. Carlos' goal is to buy a house in a quieter area, as he fears that their children could be influenced by crime.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad, 47 years old, is married with four children. Her husband works in a cafeteria.

Suad has a sewing machine at home that she uses to make clothes and to embroider on fabrics to make bed and pillow covers. What Suad lacks is basic materials, so she has applied for this loan in order to buy more threads, beads, buttons and other materials so she can sew as many clothes as she can to sell.

loans.use: To buy more material, threads, beads, and buttons

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda, 42 years old, is married with five sons and daughters. After her husband retired from his first job, he had to look for another to be able to continue supporting the family.

Raghda is also helping her husband. She goes to wholesale markets and buys home products to sell to neighbors and friends. She hopes that one day she can open a small home products store. But for now, she has applied for this loan to get more home products to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell

loans.name: Nestor Eucario

texts.es:
Nestor es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad que ya tiene una gran experiencia en las actividades del campo, pues sus padres se han dedicado a esta actividad durante toda su vida y a Nestor se la enseñaron desde muy temprana edad. Hace aproximadamente 2 años, Nestor decidió comenzar con su propio negocio y fue así como solicitó un préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera, la cual trabajó durante un buen tiempo e hizo que generara buenos ingresos, sin embargo, su vaca se enfermó y murió haciendo que su negocio tuviera que cerrar y tuviera que buscar diferentes alternativas para pagar el préstamo con el que compró su vaca. Gracias a esta experiencia, Nestor aprendió la lección y ahora se siente con mayores capacidades para tener su propio negocio; es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de ganado para reiniciar su propio negocio y así generar sus propios ingresos.
De esta manera podrá contribuir económicamente en su hogar a la vez que puede progresar financieramente por su cuenta, lo que le permitirá tener un futuro económico más estable y a su familia le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nestor is a young man who is 21 years of age. He already has extensive farming experience since his parents have been in this line of work their entire lives. They taught Nestor at a very early age. Approximately two years ago, Nestor decided to start his own business so he applied for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He was able to generate a good income for awhile, but the cow got sick and died. He was forced to shut down his business and look for different alternatives to repay the loan he used to buy the cow.

Thanks to this experience, Nestor learned his lesson and now feels more capable of managing his own business. For this reason, he is seeking the opportunity to access a loan so that he can buy cattle and restart his business. This will help him generate his own household income so that he can support himself. As a result, Nestor will have a more secure financial future and be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Libia Maria

texts.es: Libia es una mujer trabajadora de 64 años de edad. Vive en una casa propia en Guayaquil, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente sus hijos ya son mayores de edad (40 Y 34 años) no vive con ellos ya que tienen su propia familia. La tienda la inicio hace 20 años, escogió el comercio por l falta de empleo en esos tiempos y la poca preparación que contaba. Administra sola su negocio, abre a las 6 am y cierra a las 22 am. Le gusta su negocio porque se siente productiva ganando su propio dinero. Libia nos cuenta que la delincuencia no le preocupa mucho, su salud si, a veces se levanta cansada y medio enferma. Con el crédito va a comprar arroz, aceite, avenas, azúcar y demás. Le gustaría en un futuro poder arreglar su casa para hacer unos departamentos para alquiler.
texts.en:
Libia is a hardworking woman of 64 years. She lives in her own house in Guayaquil; she is divorced and has 2 children. Now that her children are adults (40 and 34 years old) she does not live with them, since they have their own families. 

She started her store 20 years ago. She chose this business because of the lack of employment in those times and the small amount of education that she had. She runs her business by herself, opening at 6 a.m. and closing at 10 p.m. She likes her business because she feels productive earning her own money.

Libia tells us that crime doesn’t bother her too much, but her health does; sometimes she wakes up feeling tired and a little sick. With this loan, she is going to buy rice, oil, oats, sugar, and other items. In the future, she would like to be able to remodel her house in order to create some apartments to rent out.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna, 48 years old, is a married woman. Her husband is a car electrician who works abroad. They have five children living all together in a rented house.

Not having citizenship in Jordan has not given them a lot of opportunities, so to be able to help support the family (in addition to what her husband sends them every month), Muna has been doing a small trading business selling clothes, makeup products, perfumes, and accessories. The products vary depending on what she found in the market with a good price and what the customers need.

She has applied for this loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes from the free zone area to get them in a better price.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes from the free zone area

loans.name: Elizabeth Eufemia

texts.es: Elizabeth es madre soltera de un niño de 8 años. Vive con sus padres en Milagros. Es bachiller y tiene 29 años.  Empezó a trabajar desde los 15 años porque siempre le gusto el comercio, inicialmente era vendedora ambulante en la actualidad tiene un local que administra. Como tiene un hijo que asiste a la escuela se ayuda económicamente vendiendo desayunos. Su horario de trabajo es de 7 am a 7 pm de lunes a sábado, su hijo menor le ayuda al salir de clases, dice que le gusta mucho vender. En su negocio tiene a la venta artículos de bazar, papelería y ropa. Le preguntamos si a tenido alguna dificulta, no dice que no porque es muy conocida en su barrio y no le teme a la delincuencia. Con el préstamo va aumentar su inventario y su meta es a largo plazo ya que desea comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single mother with an eight-year-old son. She lives with her parents in Milagros. Elizabeth is 29 years old and a high school graduate. She began working 15 years ago because she always enjoyed the retail trade. Elizabeth started out as a street vendor, but now she has a store that she manages. Now that her son attends school, she is able to help financially by selling breakfast. Her work schedule is from 7am to 7pm, Monday through Saturday. Her son helps her when he is done with his classes and says that he likes to sell.

Elizabeth sells bazaar products, stationery, and clothing in her business. When asked if she has had any difficulties, Elizabeth is not hesitant to respond since the existence of crime in her neighborhood is well known. However, she is not afraid. With this loan, she will be able to increase her inventory. Her long-term goal is to acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy paper goods, perfumes, and snacks.

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en:
Hamda, 52 years old, is a widow.
 
Four years ago, Hamda started to sell special homemade seasoned beans on a cart, and during this time she was able to buy more carts and have her son sell too in his extra time after work. 

Every day she moves from one neighborhood to another to expand the area she covers. Now her customers either remember the day she is supposed to be in the neighborhood, or go around looking for her to buy those delicious beans.

Now Hamda want to buy more carts and start employing young men who are looking for jobs to support themselves and their families. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more carts and start employing more people

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative lady. She asked her brother to take her place in the photo.

Iman is a 39-year-old divorced woman who now lives in the family house. Because she felt like a burden on her family, Iman has recently started a small business selling clothes.
  
She now has applied for this loan so she can buy a larger quantity of clothes, probably from the free zone area, to expand her trading business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, single and lives with six family members, three of whom work.

Sadek has owned a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to renovate his market, to install a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: in order to renovate his market, to install a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mindonio

texts.es: Don Mindonio tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos,  su esposa es una persona muy luchadora, ella siempre esta pendiente de su esposo y de su trabajo aparte de atender las tareas del hogar y sus hijos. Don Mindonio se dedica al cultivo de café oficio que aprendió desde que era un niño ya que trabajaba en conjunto con su abuelo, desde hace 20 años el inicio a cultivar su propia finca el cual el trabajo lo realiza a diario, desde las 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm. Por otra parte, una de las ventajas de don Mindonio es que le pagan a buen precio el grano y que tiene una muy buen producción de Café. Don Mindonio esta solicitando este préstamo ya que necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes y chapear la tierra, y así darle un mejor y adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo. Los problemas que ha enfrentado es que ha tenido dificultades económicas ya que los intermediarios le prestan dinero a intereses muy altos. Su meta es poco a poco ir tecnificando su finca y que esta le genere mayores ganancias para comprar un medio de trasporte y poder trasladar su producto. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y piensa invertir muy bien el dinero para luego pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Mindonio is 57 years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a real fighter. She is always attentive to her husband and to her job, as well as to the household and her children. Mindonio grows coffee, a skill that he learned working alongside his grandfather as a young boy. Twenty years ago, he started to cultivate his own farm, which he works on daily from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm. One of the advantages that Mindonio has is that he gets a good price for his coffee and he produces a fair amount.

Mindonio is requesting this loan because he needs to buy fertilizer and manure and to clear his land, so that he can take better care of his plants. The problem he faces is that he had economic difficulties in the past because intermediaries lent him money but charged very high interest. Mindonio's goal is to modernize his farm little-by-little and to generate more income so that he can buy a mode of transportation and be able to transport his products. This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he thinks he will invest this money very well and be able to pay back his monthly quotas punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Ra'eqa

texts.en:
Ra’eqa is a 53-year-old married woman who has previously applied for a loan to buy more material to make more carpets and rugs.

Now Ra’eqa has applied for this loan to do some maintenance to the equipment she uses to make carpets. Ra’eqa has enhanced the products she makes and she now takes customized order and sells it with a higher price, of course. She hopes that soon she can recruit someone to help her in the business so she can deliver her orders on time.

loans.use: to do some maintenance to the equipment she uses to make carpets

loans.name: Abdel

texts.en:
Abdel Hussein, 46, is from Iraq and is married with three children. Since 2010, he has owned a food market, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field with a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2000 loan to install a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs. He hopes to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to install a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children.

Fallah has owned a restaurant since 2005, where he offers traditional Iraqi food. He gained sufficient experience in this field from his previous work. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for a $2,000 loan in order to purchase a chicken grill machine and to install showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a chicken grill machine and to install showcases.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a woman with eight children, six of whom are attending school. She is married to a primary school teacher who also provides the family's basic needs through his monthly earnings. Saida operates a shop where she sells her goods mostly to her neighbors, and she aspires to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes seasonality to be her major challenge, especially during good harvests when the number of customers decreases. She plans to use her loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Jose Luciano

texts.es:
El señor José de 49 años de edad, es casado con la señora milagro quien le ayuda con la venta del pescado que el pesca en el mar, tiene su casa propia ubicada en una aldea de Amapala al sur de honduras, Don José tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos estudian y los otros dos trabajan fuera del país, Don José se dedica desde muy joven a la pesca artesanal donde con gran esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante a su familia, su negocio consiste en salir al mar todo los días por las noches a buscar el pescado que luego con la ayuda de su esposa el logra venderlo en el mercado de Tegucigalpa. 
Don José solicita el préstamo para compra de semilla de sandia, abono, insumos y reparación de las redes de pesca, con el apoyo del préstamo Don José desea cultivar sandias y con las ganancias quiere comprarse un nuevo motor para su lancha.
El sueño de Don José es tener otra lancha para pescar con mas fuerza y así tener mejores ganancias para darles mejor vida a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sr. José is 49 years old and married to Sra. Milagro, who helps him sell the fish that he catches from the sea. They have their own home in a neighborhood of Amapala in southern Honduras. Don José has four children, two of whom are studying while the other two are working outside of the country. He has been fishing since he was a very young man. With great effort, he has been able to move his family forward. His business involves heading out to sea each night in search of fish. Afterwards, his wife helps sell what he catches at the market in Tegucigalpa.

Don José is requesting a loan so that he can buy watermelon seeds, compost, and farming supplies, as well as pay for repairs to his fishing nets. With the help of this loan, Don José will be able to grow watermelons and use his earnings to purchase a new motor for his boat. His dream is to own another fishing boat that is more powerful. This will help him earn more income so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his fishing nets and to buy seeds, compost, and farming supplies for growing watermelon.

loans.name: Geofferey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 44-year-old businessman. He is married, and they have four children. He has been in the transport business for the past 10 years, with a monthly income of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to service the vehicle. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he plans to sustain his family and improve their living standards. His hope and dream is to own several transport vehicles.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married and has five children.

Ali is a tailor; in 1990 he opened his shop. He makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for men. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1000 loan to purchase a tailoring machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old and a businessman. He is married to Miriam and they have two children. Joseph has been selling car spare parts for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family members. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. Joseph will use the loan to purchase mechanic working tools like spanners, bolts, etc. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he intends to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard for his family and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic working tools like spanners, bolts etc

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Candelaria es una prospera comerciante, empezó vendiendo algunos alimentos que ella misma preparaba para esto acondiciono algunas mesas en la puerta de su casa, durante mucho tiempo se convirtió en un lugar muy frecuentado para consumir  los diversos platos que ella vendía, con los ahorros de su  trabajo pudo inaugurar la  bodega que ahora tiene. En su negocio vende todo tipo de productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, fideos, bebidas, verduras, carnes etc. ya son cerca de 6 años que tiene su negocio, durante todo este tiempo se ha  convertido en uno de los más exitosos del lugar, este progreso en su trabajo es de mucha ayuda para ella porque así a logrado el sustento de su familia, para más adelante quiere  ampliar su bodega con todo tipo de productos, su préstamo le será de mucha ayuda para comprar diversos productos, básicamente menestras y gaseosas. La Sra. Candelaria es miembro del grupo “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO” son vecinas y amigas de Puente Piedra  zona al norte de Lima Perú.

*La Sra. Candelaria viste polo plomo y  pantalón corto color rojo.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a successful businesswoman. She began selling food that she prepared herself; in order to do this, she set up some tables in the doorway of her house. After a while, this became a place where many people came to eat the various dishes that she offered. With the savings from her work, she was able to open the small store that she has now.

From her business, she sells all kinds of food items, such as rice, sugar, noodles, drinks, vegetables, meat, and others. She has had her business for about 6 years. During this time, it has become one of the most successful businesses in the area. This progress in her work is very helpful for her, because through it she has been able to earn a living for her family. In the future, she wants to expand her store with all kinds of products. Her loan will help her to buy various products, mostly bulk foods and soft drinks.

Candelaria is a member of the group “Prosperidad Y Éxito” (Prosperity and Success), composed of neighbors and friends from the Puente Piedra region north of Lima, Perú.

*Candelaria is wearing a gray shirt and red shorts.

loans.use: to purchase bulk foods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 36 years old and single. He has owned a fruits and vegetables store for five years.

Now that people knows Zakaria is in the market, he decided to expand the shop and make a section to sell grocery items. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to expand the shop and make a section to sell grocery items

loans.name: Amlet

texts.en:
Amlet is a 44-year-old farmer from Bolnisi District, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife, Ailita; a 22-year-old son; and his retired parents. 

The family earns a living through agriculture. All family members are involved in the family business. In particular, they have a dairy farm with four milk cows and eight calves. Ailita and her mother-in-law produce cheese and sell it in the village to local dairy-products retailers. 

The family owns 1 hectare of land, where cucumbers, tomatoes and haricot are grown. Amlet sells harvested products on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned, Amlet is busy with beekeeping. He has six beehives with bee colonies. Amlet harvests honey twice a year and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Amlet requested credit for purchasing additional calves. He will purchase the calves and grow them for five months. After this period, Amlet will sell grown calves and get the profit, which will be reinvested in the business to expand it and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Lita Guadalupe

texts.es: Lita vive en Portoviejo con su esposo una de sus cuatro hijos. Su hija Jaricksa de 16 años estudia en el colegio fiscal, sus otros hijos son mayores de edad. Su esposo lleva 11 años de guardia de seguridad. A sus 52 años Lita se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y la costura. Hace 20 años su papa que era sastre le enseño la profesión, agradece mucho esa enseñanza porque es su forma de vida. El taller lo tiene en su casa y realiza la labor a cualquier hora del día. De su barrio destaca que es tranquilo, existe la delincuencia pero como es conocida no ha tenido ninguna novedad. Con el crédito comprara perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, telas. Le gustaría en otro préstamo comprarse una maquina overlot para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lita lives in Portoviejo with her husband and one of their four children. Her daughter Jaricksa is 16 years old and attends public school; her other children are older. Her husband has been a security guard for 11 years. 

At the age of 52, Lita works selling products through a catalog. She also sews; twenty years ago her father, who was a tailor, taught her the profession. She is very grateful for this training because it is her way of life. She has the shop in her house, and she works all hours of the day. 

She points out that her neighborhood is peaceful; crime exists, but as she is well-known, she has not had any problems. With this loan, she will buy perfumes, lotions, makeup, and fabric. She would like another loan to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, perfume, and lotion.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Now that Ali has four daughters and a son, he decided to concentrate more on his cafeteria so he can support his family. Ali is still working as a call center officer during the daytime. After that job, he goes to work in his own cafeteria selling hot and cold drinks and snacks. Recently he added a few shelves that he wants to fill with new types of snacks like biscuits, chocolate, etc. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goods and snacks for the cafeteria.

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en:
Hamda, 36, is from Iraq and is married with four children. She has been a professional tailor since 2010. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing, including suits, coats, and trousers, for women and children. She has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2000 loan to purchase a tailoring machine and fabric. She hopes to gain more profits to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and fabric.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer, 25 years old, is a married lady. Because she is a conservative housewife, she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Her husband, Salem, works in a governmental entity but he helps his wife after work buy more clothes at wholesale prices. Abeer works at home in a clothing retail business with the help of her husband. She is managing to succeed in this business.
 
Now she has applied for a youth loan to buy more products other than clothes, such as sheets and covers.

loans.use: to buy products such as sheets and covers to sell

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal, 47 years old, is a married woman. Her husband owns a garage for fixing cars. They have five sons and daughters.

Feryal has a small retail business at home selling blankets. Now she is looking to sell lighter bed covers that are suitable for the spring and summer seasons. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy lighter bed covers to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 29, is married with three children, ages 5, 6, and 8. He sells milk and has been in business for a year and a half, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000.  

He is now seeking his first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD to purchase a bicycle that will help him deliver milk to his esteemed customers. He would also use the loan to purchase a milk storage container. The profits will be reinvested in his business and new business ventures. His dream is to improve in business.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle and milk storage container.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food selling business, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of owning a café in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to build up a business structure, purchase timber and iron sheets. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to build up a business structure, purchase timber and iron sheets.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 46 years old. She lives in Bolnisi District, East Georgia with her family; her husband Leri and two sons (22 and 21 years old). Liana leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, she is busy with the family dairy farm, with 2 milk cows. Liana produces and sells on average 30 kg of cheese per month. She sells produced cheese at the local market to dairy product retailers. Her husband and sons are stone masons. They work in Bolnisi District, as well as in nearby districts on construction or renovation work. The total average monthly income of the family is 1400 lari. 

Liana requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase 2 milk cows and will be able to double production and sales of cheese. It will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Mariées exclusivement dans des familles traditionnelles les 4 femmes du groupe  Sabaly  ont  en moyenne 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Koutiala,  région de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités professionnelles. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales, de pagnes,  de jarres, etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 15 eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les 14 précédents.
Madame,  Marama  (la première femme à droite, les mains sur la jarre, sur la photo) est une grande  vendeuse de jarres, qui est très sollicitée et appréciée pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 120 jarres (à raison de 1250 FCFA l'unité). Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de la place et effectue ses ventes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Marama espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabaly group are all married women living in traditional families. On average, they are 50 years old and they have four children each. They live in the city of Koutiala, in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali), and they know each other as neighbors, as colleagues, and through ties of kinship. They buy and sell cereals, pagnes, jars, etc.

To increase their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is 15th group loan, and all previous loans were correctly repaid. 

Mrs. Marama (first from the right with her hands on the jar) is an important seller of jars. She is in high demand due to the quality of her merchandise. 
She plans to use her loan to buy 120 jars (for 1,250 FCFA each). She buys her merchandise from local wholesalers and conducts her sales at retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.

Mrs. Marama hopes that this loan will help her to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFAF, which she will reinvest in her activity and use to cover some of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy jars.

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 6 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe Sérieux vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de l’huile végétale, gingembre, de pagnes wax et de la salade - concombre. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Abi (assise au milieu sur la photo) est la vendeuse de salades et du concombre du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4paniers de salades + 2 paniers de concombre /jour.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Abi compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.750 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sérieux group are married women who live, for the most part, in traditional families and average 39 years of age and 4 children each.  They all reside in the city of Sikasso and know each other through neighborhood, kinship or marriage ties. They sell vegetable oil, ginger, wax fabrics, leafy greens and cucumber.

In order to increase their business, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan.

Abi (sitting, in the center of the photo) is the group member who sells leafy greens and cucumbers.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 4 baskets of greens and 2 baskets of cucumbers per day.

She buys her goods from local farmers and sells retail for cash, from her home and at the market, to a customer base which consists of men and women.

With this loan, Abi is expecting average monthly profits to reach 31,750 CFA francs which will be reinvested in the activity and also used to help her husband pay for some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy leafy greens and cucumbers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a forty-five-year-old married woman with eleven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in coffee for four years. Her hardships are price fluctuation and inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather. Personal goals are educating her children and building a home. Business goals are diversifying the business, buying land to grow crops and expanding the business into new markets. Esther wants money to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 45-year-old businessman who deals in produce, mainly maize and beans. He has 6 children and has been selling these cereals for a period of 4 years. He faces a problem of price fluctuation and inflation which erodes most of the profits and inadequate capital. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to other areas. Francis wants a loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Fenekansi

texts.en: Fenekansi is a 36-year-old businessman who deals in produce, mainly maize and beans. He has been in this business for a period of 3 years. He started by growing tomatoes and then sold them and got capital and started this business. Fenekansi faces a problem of price fluctuation and inflation which erodes most of the profits, and high fuel and transport costs. He would like to buy a car, diversify his business into processing and buy land for growing crops. Fenekansi wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Byron Oliver

texts.es: Byron nació en Simón Bolívar, actualmente vive en Milagros. Tiene 18 años de edad vive con sus padres. Cuando termino el colegio empezó su negocio por un anuncio en el periódico.  Sin dinero pero con el deseo de superarme comencé a trabajar en una distribuidora, mi horario era solo por las mañanas. Luego ofrecí los productos  a amigos y familiares para reunir el capital necesario y alquilar un local. No tiene horario fijo pero mantiene su negocio abierto de lunes a domingos. Principalmente vende batidos a base de productos vegetarianos, te. Como su local es alquilado nos cuenta que en la zona su principal inconveniente son los borrachos por la bulla que hacen. El préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para sus batidos, te y aloe.
texts.en:
Byron was born in Simón Bolívar and currently lives in Milagros. He is 18 years old and he lives with his parents. When he finished high school, he began his business with an advertisement in the newspaper.

"Without money, but with a desire for self-improvement, I began working at a distributor. My schedule was only in the morning. Later I offered products to friends and family members to gather the necessary capital to rent a business space."

He doesn't have a set schedule, but he keeps his business open from Monday to Sunday. He mainly sells smoothies made from vegetarian products and tea. Since his business space is rented, he tells us that the main inconvenience in his area are the drunks because of the noise that they make. He is going to invest the loan in products for his smoothies, tea, and aloe.

loans.use: to purchase products for smoothies and aloe

loans.name: Talapkan

texts.ru:
Талапкан 53 года, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Талапкан с 1998 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Талапкан имеется 10 овец с ягнятами, 5 коз и 1 лошадь. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Талапкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Талапкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Talapkan is 53 years old, married and has raised four children. As a source of main income for her family she has been doing animal husbandry since 1998, a business which she started with the amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Today Talapkan has ten sheep with lambs, five goats and one horse. 

With a goal to further grow her business Talapkan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som to buy a milk cow. She plans to invest the profits into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Zulfunoi

texts.ru: Зулфиной замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Более 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей мужской обуви и одежды. В бизнесе помогает ей её муж. Приобретает товар один раз в неделю на рынке города. Зулфиной хотела бы получить займ для покупки летней обуви и одежды для расширения ассортимента товаров. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulfinoi is married and is a loving mother of three children. She has been reselling men's shoes and clothing for more than ten years. Her husband helps her in this business. She buys the goods once a week on the town's market. Zulfinoi wants to get a loan to buy summer shoes and clothing to increase the variety of her merchandise. She is hoping for your help and is grateful for your kindness in advance.

loans.use: to buy summer shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 03 enfants. Le premier a 15ans et le dernier 02ans. Deux sont à l’école.
Enyonam travaille comme revendeuse de matériaux de construction depuis 2008. Elle vend dans une boutique.et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le terrain.
Enyonam a requis son cinquième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de construction Elle veut agrandir son activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Enyonam is a 29-year-old woman.  She is married to a reseller and has three children.  The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 2.  Two of her children are in school.

Enyonam has been reselling construction supplies since 2008.  She sells in a shop, and her main challenge is local competition.

Enyonam has requested her fifth loan from WAGES for the purchase of construction supplies.  She wants to expand her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Ehtibor

texts.ru: Эхтибор замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Более 12 лет он занимается купле- продажей обуви. Муж является шофером. Приобретает товар 2- 3 раза в неделю. В бизнесе помогает ей её сын. Она имеет много постоянных клиентов и это помогает ей успешно продолжать свой бизнес. Эхтибор хотела бы получить займ для покупки летней обуви с целью расширения бизнеса. Эхтибор надеется на вашу доброту и щедрость.
texts.en:
Ehtibor is married and the loving mother of four children.  She has been buying and selling shoes for more than 12 years.  Her husband is a driver. 

Ehtibor acquires merchandise two or three times a week.  Her son helps her with the business.  She has many loyal customers, and this allows her to successfully carry on her business.

In order to expand her business, Ehtibor would like to receive a loan to buy summer shoes.  She is looking forward to your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to buy summer shoes.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María  de 27 años vive ( playa  Ecuador ). Ella decidió entra a este negocio hace  2 años que es la despensa de víveres   lo hizo actualmente construye locales comerciales  le va bien  aparte vende productos de bazar. Es soltera. A futuro anhela tener su familia bien  y mejorar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (víveres  para enlatdos, bebidas, confites).
texts.en: María is 27 years old and she lives in Playas, Ecuador. She sells groceries, an activity she decided to engage in 2 years ago; at the moment she is also engaged in building commercial locales, on top of keeping on selling general goods. She is single, and in the future she hopes to have a family and to improve her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as canned food, drinks and candies.

loans.use: To buy canned food, drinks and candies.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar los niños y cuando puede también le colabora en los trabajos del campo, es una familia muy trabajadora y honesta. Juan aprendió el negocio de su papa, ya que le regalo una manzana para que cultivara la tierra y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su finca de cafe, el horario laboral es de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm y cuando es temporada de cosecha trabaja todo el día ya que el trabajo lo amerita. Una de las dificultades que Juan presenta es la falta de mano de obra para realizar el corte y la recolección de café y que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder hacer crecer su finca. El préstamo que Juan solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la finca y poder sembrar más café. Una de sus metas es poder tener una mayor producción de café para obtener mayores ganancias y así poder sacar adelante a su familia. Este es el primer financiamiento de Juan en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 28 years old, he is married and he has 3 children. His wife takes care of the household chores and looking after the children and when she can she also helps with the farm work. They are a very hardworking and honest family.

Juan learned this business from his dad as he gave him a plot of land to cultivate and his coffee plantation has gradually grown. The working day is from 6.00 am until 1.00 pm and when it is harvesting season he works all day as it is very worthwhile. One of the difficulties that Juan faces is the lack of labor for picking and collecting the coffee beans and he does not have enough money to increase the size of his plantation. 

Juan needs the requested loan to invest in fertilizers to improve his plantation and sow more coffee seeds. One of his goals is to have a greater coffee production in order to make a better profit and therefore get his family ahead in life. This is Juan’s first FAMA loan and he hopes to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 6 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe Tièssiri vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso  et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de condiments, chaussures, de charbons de bois et d’encens. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djeneba (debout à droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de chaussures du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 douzaines  de chaussures en plastique.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Djeneba compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The majority of the six members of the Tièssiri group, who are all married women, live in traditional families and average 42 years of age with four children each. They all live in the town of Sikasso and got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and marriage.

The group members have small trading activities, selling condiments, shoes, charcoal and incense. They joined Soro Yiriwaso with a view to increasing their business volume and are now on their fifth group loan. 

Djeneba (standing on the right of the photo) is the shoe seller in the group. She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 dozen plastic shoes. She gets her supplies from wholesalers and sells them on a retail basis, for cash, from home and in the market, to a diverse customer base. With this loan Djeneba is expecting to make an average monthly rofit of 22,500FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Los Girasoles Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 44 años es casada y tiene 5 hijos, fue su hermana quien la alentó a trabajar en la venta de ropa y diversos artículos como zapatillas y zapatos, alguna vez llego a tener un local donde vendía directamente al público, su negocio  iba muy bien pero al no recibir el apoyo de su familia tuvo que dejarlo, después de algún tiempo nuevamente empezó el mismo negocio pero de diferente manera ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa, sus clientes son en su mayoría amistades, familiares y personas que la conocen. Con su préstamo comprara ropa y calzado aprovechando que se avecina el día de las madres y las ventas aumentan, su trabajo es de mucha ayuda para colaborar en el sustento de su familia, sobretodo apoyar  a sus hijos en los estudios, espera en un futuro cercano volver a tener su propio bazar; donde pueda exhibir sus productos para así obtener más ingresos, el grupo al cual pertenece  se llama “LOS GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL” está conformado por 10 socias.

* La Sra. Vilma esta de cuclillas viste chompa.
texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old, she is married and she has 5 children. It was her sister who encouraged her to work selling clothes and other items such as slippers and shoes. At one time she managed to have a premises where she sold directly to the public. Her business was going very well but due to a lack of support from her family she had to give it up. After a while she started up the same business again but in a different way. She sold her products from house to house and her customers are mainly her friends, family and acquaintances. With her loan she will buy clothes and footwear, taking advantage of the fact that Mothers’ Day is coming up and sales will rise. Her job is a great contributor to the maintenance of her family, especially in supporting her children in their education. She hopes that in near future she will have her own store once again, where she can display her products and therefore earn a better income.
