She also makes a living by making tostadas, selling chicken, and raising pigs, which she has done for 18 years because she really likes to work.  She tells us that she goes to the neighboring towns like Ometepec, Zacatepec, Pinotepa and colonies of their community to sell her handicrafts.  

One of the things that she likes most is making the tablecloths and combining the colors of her huipiles and tablecloths.  She also likes to embroider the flowers with pieces of yarn.  One of her dreams is to enlarge her business and improve the quality of life of her family and fellow countryman.

She asked for the loan to buy more ingredients for making her huipiles, napkins, and tablecloths; like unbleached cotton cloth, yarn, sewing thread, crystal acrylic thread, lace, and satin fabric.  She tells us that she is very grateful to the Foundation for supporting all the people from marginalized towns.

The other members of the group are:
Julia - she makes a living selling embroidery.
Carmen - she makes a living selling bread.
Alma Delia - she makes a living selling grocery goods.

They give thanks to the Foundation for helping so that their lives improve more each day.

loans.use: to buy material for making tablecloths and napkins.

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito is married and has 3 children. He is 42 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Paquito is operating a retail business, selling a variety of different products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years and every month he earns 8,000.00 PHP from this work. 

Paquito has requested a loan of 20,000.00 PHP to purchase new items to expand the product offering. In 2011, Paquito joined GDMPC. He hopes to improve the general living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is from the Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 62 years old. Pamela is widowed and has 2 children. To make a living, Pamela owns and operates a business in the food sector making and selling food. Pamela has been in her business for 6 years and earns 1,500 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Pamela joined GDMPC. Pamela is requesting a loan of 3,600 PHP which will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Pamela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita, a 64-year-old widow with five children, is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Conchita sells food and home-used items such as candies, etc. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 2,000 PHP per month.

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 3,800 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is from Malaubang, Ozamiz city. She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. Roselyn buys and sells fish for a living and has been in her business for 8 years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Roselyn joined GDMPC. Roselyn is requesting a loan of 8,600 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is 44 years old, married and lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City with her 4 children. She runs a carinderia, or eatery, type of business that she started two years ago. That business gives her a monthly income of 2,000 PHP. Her interest in cooking has inspired her to invest in this kind of business. With the desire to improve it, she would like to borrow the amount of 3,300 PHP from GDMPC. She will use the loan in order to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Jovita has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In God’s time, she hopes for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is 49 years old. Warlito is married and is a loving father of four children. He lives in Namnama village, in the Isabela area, with his wife, his children, his parents, and his brother. He is a responsible and goal-oriented person. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Warlito primarily grows corn. He wants to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to treat the land in order to get a good harvest. He also needs money to pay for his employees' work. This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 30,000 PHP. Warlito thanks all creditors who will support him.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León en crédito durante el financiamiento ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, su mayor sueño de la emprendedora es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y brindarle lo mejor. La emprendedora nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su producto y de igual manera sus clientes, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra maíz, cal, bolsas, leña entre otros  productos.
texts.en: Vilma is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León since her previous loan. During the financing she has proven to be a responsible person who wishes to outdo herself. The biggest dream of this entrepreneur is that her children finish their studies and to provide them with the best. The entrepreneur expresses to us that thanks to the loan she has increased her production and also her customers. Currently she is applying for a loan to purchase corn, slaked lime, bags and firewood among other products.

loans.use: to purchase corn, slaked lime, bags and firewood among other products.

loans.name: Sante

texts.en: Sante is a hard-working man. At 47 years old, he is married and lives happily under his own humble roof. Ever since he was very young, Sante has lived surrounded by neighbors and friends who dedicate themselves to agriculture, so he grew up accustomed to the labors of the field and still grows rice and corn. When he was 20 years old, Sante had to take the reins as head of the family and look after his little brothers after his father died. This was how he came to dedicate his life to farming. While the crops were growing, Sante would also work as a laborer in other people's farms and as a bricklayer, so that he could ensure his little brothers' education could continue. Sante is very reliable. With the money, Sante will be able to buy seed to grow and fertilizers to enrich the soil for the crops he plans to harvest in September. He will also pay hired laborers for their help in sowing, cultivating, and harvesting the crop.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a 50-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Namnama province of Isabela. He is married and lives with his family. He has been growing corn for several years. He learned to do this from his father. This work makes Felix very happy. Due to his experience, he is able to do many farm processes perfectly. Now he needs to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to start the process of planting corn. The purchase of these materials will be a great help for Felix. His dream is to one day have his own home and build a house.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Gina is married and has two children. To make a living, Gina manages a banana production business. Gina has been in her business for 12 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 22,200 PHP, which will be used to buy farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Annie Lou

texts.en: Annie Lou is married and has two children. Annie Lou is 27 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. Annie Lou owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 9,356 PHP to purchase new items in order to expand her product offerings. In 2011, Annie Lou joined GDMPC. In the future, Annie Lou wants to build a house and see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase new products

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 37 years old, married and has one child. Rosalie owns and operates a retail store, a business she has been engaged in for five years. She earns 13,000 PHP a month from it. In 2010, Rosalie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 22,200 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman having seven children. Alma is 41 years old, residing at Malaubang, Ozamis city, Philippines. Alma has started a business venture, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living and she's been 4 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,094 PHP to purchase fish, crabs, shrimp and clams.

 Alma has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Alma wants to improve her house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fish, crabs, shrimp and clams

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María Inés, tiene 61 años de edad, es casada, vive en una aldea de Intibucá con su familia y sus dos hijos de 17 y 23 años de edad.
Ella desde muy pequeña aprendió su oficio de corte y confección, su habilidad es confeccionar delantales o gabachas que se usan para cocinar, y los vende en la misma comunidad. Trabaja por pedidos de sus clientes.
El préstamo que solicita es el primero y lo necesita para comprar tela, hilos y encajes que utiliza para confeccionar los delantales que le han pedido. Su meta es abaratar costos comprando en cantidad los materiales y con la ganancia solventar la situación económica del hogar.
texts.en:
María Inés, 61, is married.  She lives in a village in Intibucá with her family and her two children who are 17 and 23 years of age.

Since she was little she learned dressmaking.  Her skill is to make aprons called “gabachas” that can be worn while cooking that she sells in her community.  She works according to customer orders.

The loan she’s asking for is her first one and she needs it to buy fabric, thread and lace she will use to make the aprons she has on order.  Her goal is to reduce costs by purchasing her materials in quantity and use profits to attain her home’s economic solvency.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is 51 years old and single. She is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. Dinah used her last loan to purchase "Guso" (seaweed). Her business grew and became more successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan for her agriculture business, to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelia is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emelia has a spice retail business in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her food stall.

Emelia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers.

Geraldine has been in this business for three years. Geraldine earns more income from a beauty parlor.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, is 25 years old and married. To make a living, Mary Grace has owned and operated a motor transport service for two years, earning 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Mary Grace joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Mary Grace plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Rolando es originario de Teustepe, de  55 años de edad, casado, realizo estudios hasta la primaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace 36 años actividad que inicio con su papa trabajando en la siembra de frijol para el consumo propio hoy en día se dedica a la misma actividad pero para comercializarlos en otros lugares donde le paguen  un mejor precio,  en el negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, su expectativa es seguir trabajando en su actividad hasta que pueda. Realiza el préstamo para compra de insumos, fertilizantes, plaguicida, abono y pago de mano de obra,  el cual estima el préstamo le ayudara  ya que podrá invertir en abonos refrescantes para un mejor rendimiento en su cosecha.
texts.en:
Rolando is from Teustepe.  He’s 55 years old, married and attended elementary school.  He’s a merchant.  He farms basic grains, an activity he’s had for the last 36 years having started working with his father planting beans for their own consumption.  

Today he’s in the same line of work but in order to sell them in other places where better prices are paid for them.  His children help him do the work.  

His expectation is to continue working in his activity as long as possible.  He is taking out this loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, bug killer, manure and to pay for day laborers.  He believes the loan will help him because he will be able to buy replenishing manure for better crop yields.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Jonatan

texts.es:
Jonatán tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene 5 hijos entre 14 y 4 años de edad, vive en el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
El señor Jonatán tiene hace 10 años un negocio de una Botánica donde vende hierbas, medicina natural, velas aromáticas, lociones etc. Antes el trabajaba de manera ambulante vendiendo sus productos, pero actualmente tuvo la oportunidad de establecer su propio local ubicado en un lugar estratégico de afluencia de personas, y por lo tanto sus ventas son muy favorables porque ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
El solicita un préstamo de 14,000 lempiras para comprar variedad de hierbas para elaborar las medicinas y surtir la el negocio con otros productos. El con esta inversión quiere proporcionar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y calidad de producto.
Después de haber logrado comprar su casa, la prioridad que el tiene actualmente es darle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jonatán is 38 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 4 and 14. They live in the town of Tela, Atlántida.

For the past 10 years, Sr. Jonatán has managed a botanical shop where he sell herbs, natural medicines, aromatherapy candles, lotions, and other products. He previously sold his products as a street vendor, but he then got the opportunity to establish is own shop in a strategic location where many people visit. His sales have been quite favorable because he is able to satisfy the needs of his customers.

Jonatán is requesting a loan of 14,000 HNL so that he can buy a variety of herbs for producing medicines and other products to restock his business. With this investment, he will be able to provide his customers with better service and quality products. Later on he would like to buy a house, but his current priority is providing for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase herbs and other botanical products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  tiene 42 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de leche, ella vive en la localidad de Huayrocondo Los Andes, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de una vaca  lechera y así obtener mayor cantidad de leche para la venta, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra.  Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su producción de leche y  utilizara los beneficios en incrementar su capital de inversión, su deseo es poder tener más vacas y también poder vender ella vacas lecheras a otros vendedores de leche de la localidad, la Sra. Juana  es un persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old, single and has a 4 year old son.  She sells milk.  She lives in Huayrocondo Los Andes.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Juana will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to obtain larger amounts of milk to sell.  

The reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital.  The challenge Juana faces in her business is to improve milk production.  She will use profits to increase her investment capital.  

Her wish is to have more cows and also to be able to sell dairy cows herself to other milk vendors in the area.  Juana is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful for the support provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es:
José es un hombre joven de 26 años,que es casado y tiene dos hijos, uno de tres años y otro recien nacido de dos meses. Toda la familia vive en "Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Este gran hombre trabajador, se dedica a la venta de madera desde hace 6 años; actividad que la aprendió de su familia que también se dedican a esto. Uno de los más grandes obstáculos que tiene es no tener un medio suficiente para sacar la madera a la venta y por esta razón José desea invertir en la compra de mulares para su negocio es decir comprar animales de carga. Esto le permitirá a José ahorrar en lo que paga por fletes y alquiler de transporte, con ello tendrá mayores ingresos y será dueño de su propio transporte.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a estar con su familia, su sueño es poder arreglar su finca para dedicarse a la agricultura y crianza de animales. Para ello necesita dinero y esperamos que con esta inversión esté a un paso más cerca de tener la finca de sus sueños y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, and is married with two sons, one of whom is three years old, and the other is just a few months old. Their family lives in “Los Bancos,” which is a rural community in the Province of Pichincha, which is also home to the capital city of Ecuador. One of the main natural resources present in Los Bancos is water. In fact, countless streams are born there, and then run down the slopes of the land as they form sizeable rivers. The community is bustling with trade, especially along the main street, where there are hotels, restaurants, stores, and many agricultural products for sale. There are also veterinary services and many small general stores.

José has worked hard selling wood for over six years. He learned this trade from his family members, who also work in the industry. One of the greatest challenges he has faced is how to transport wood down to the market for sale. José wants to invest in purchasing load-bearing animals for his business, which would allow him to reduce his costs for freight and renting transportation. This would simultaneously increase his income, as he would be the owner of his own transportation.

In his free time, he likes to be with his family. José’s dream is to settle his estate so he can focus his efforts on raising animals and on farming. In order to do that, he needs to save up more money. He hopes that, with the support from this loan, he will be one step closer to having the farm of his dreams and to improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase load-bearing animals for transporting timber.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar tiene 32 años y es casado tiene un hijo de  11 meses de edad, el se dedica a la venta de pollo a la parrilla, su puesto de venta se encuentra en la localidad de Limoncito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr Edgar utilizara este  préstamo  para  la compra de una parrilla más grande para su negocio ya que así podrá poner más cantidad de carne a coser,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital para la compra de su parrilla,  Edgar enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar is 32 years old, married, and has an 11-month-old son. He sells grilled chicken from a stand in the town of Limoncito. This will be his first loan cycle with Emprender. Sr. Edgar will use this loan to buy a larger grill for his business so that he can cook a larger quantity of meat. His reason for requesting this loan is that he lacks the capital to purchase the grill.

Edgar faces challenges in his business as he seeks to get out of poverty, but he plans to use his earnings to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large grill.

loans.name: Margelis Del Socorro

texts.es: Margelis Del Socorro tiene 29 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es una pulpería su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes ofreciendo una variedad de productos. Esta emprendedora tiene dos hijos que todavía están a su cargo tiene el apoyo de su esposo que siempre está con ella en todas las decisiones que tome. Margelis Del Socorro está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergentes, pan, golosinas, entre otros productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margelis Del Socorro is 29 years old.  She has a home-based grocery store where she tends to her customers offering a variety of products.  This entrepreneur has two children still in her care and her husband supports all the decisions she makes.

Margelis Del Socorro is asking for financing to buy products like basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, bread and snacks, among other products requested by her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo de 74 años de edad es originario del departamento de Estelí, de oficio comerciante se dedica al alquiler de silla y  venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años. El ha trabajado con créditos otorgados por nuestra institución financiera y Kiva , anteriormente realizo su primer crédito para compra de silla, mesas y ropa usada para vender el cual estima este préstamo le ayudo ya que pudo invertir mas en su negocio para obtener mas ganancia, se siente muy satisfecho con nuestro apoyo y hoy en día solicita un segundo préstamo para comprar ropa usada para vender, una vez cancelado su segundo préstamo el espera seguir trabajando con el apoyo de nuestra institución financiera para poder mantener su negocio y  tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 74, is from Estelí Department.  He is a merchant by profession.  He rents chairs and sells used clothes; he’s been in business five years.  

He’s worked with loans granted by our financial institution and by Kiva before.  He took out his first loan to buy chairs, tables and used clothes to sell.  He believes that the loan helped him much because he was able to invest in his business to obtain higher profits.  

He feels very satisfied with our support and today is asking for a second loan to buy used clothes to sell.  Once he repays his second loan he hopes to continue with support from our financial institution to stay in business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children run the delivery service and earn about USD 6 per day. Pov wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family's living conditions. Due to lack of funding, Pov is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase groceries for resale at home. This money will help her acquire the security to start the business and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale at home

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is married with 5 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalyn owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Rosalyn has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Rosalyn's plan is to save her returns in order to support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ester is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nipa making business.

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa making business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. Adela is married and has a spice retail business in the Philippines.

Adela requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Adela has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a watch repair business in the Philippines.

Marina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her business.

She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Gloria de 54 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo quien se dedica al trabajo de albañilería, su residencia esta ubicada en una aldea de Coyolito en el puerto de Amapala al sur de Honduras, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella ya que todos sus hijos  son independientes.
Doña Gloria se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de pescado y venta de abarrotaría como: jabón, pollo, papel higiénico, pastas, frescos, charamuscas, y azúcar, su venta es en su casa y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan.
Doña Gloria esta solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para comprar frescos, huevos, pescado, arroz, Etc. Con el préstamo desea abastecer su negocio ya que sus clientes le están solicitando productos que actualmente por falta de capital no ha podido comprar, sus metas es hacer crecer su negocio.
El sueño de Doña Gloria es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria is 54 years old, married, and lives with her husband who works as a bricklayer. Their home is located in the neighborhood of Coyolito, which is the gateway of Amapala in southern Honduras. They have no dependent children since all of them live independently.

For the past 10 years, Doña Gloria has been selling fish and grocery products such as soap, chicken, toilet paper, pasta, soft drinks, bagged ice treats, and sugar. Her store is located in her home and her customers consist of friends and neighbors who visit her on a daily basis. Doña Gloria is requesting 5,000 HNL so that she can buy soft drinks, eggs, fish, rice, and other products. She wants to restock her business with this loan because her customers are asking for and want to buy products that she does not have at the moment. Her goals include growing her business, but her dream is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, fish, and rice.

loans.name: Francis Esther

texts.es:
Francis, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, con quienes vive en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Ella realiza la actividad agrícola junto a su esposo, con quien trabaja mancomunado para el sostenimiento de la familia. Desde hace varios años cultiva maíz, yuca y hortalizas. Estos productos los comercializan en la comunidad.
Ha mejorado sus cultivos mediante préstamos, actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo de 10,300.00 Lempiras, para comprar fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de maíz, yuca y hortalizas. El propósito es sacar buenas cosechas y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francis is 26 years old, married, and has two children (ages 3 and 8). She lives with her family in a neighborhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Francis and her husband work together as farmers so that they can sustain their family. They have been growing corn, cassava, and vegetables for several years. Their products are sold in their community.

She has improved her crops through the use of loans. At the moment, Francis is requesting her third loan in the amount of 10,300 HNL so that she can buy fertilizers to help maintain her corn, cassava, and vegetable crops. Her plan is to achieve a good harvest and generate a profit so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: La Estancia  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por 8 socias quienes se dedican a las labores del campo, cría de animales y muchos laboran en el comercio, estas actividades les dan la oportunidad de solventar sus gastos y los de sus hogares, son amables, gentiles, carismáticas, manteniendo la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute, lugar que goza de un clima templado en donde sus tierras son aptas para la floricultura, siendo este cantón el mayor productor de las mejores flores y frutas, también cuenta con diversos lugares para visitar y su gastronomía es variada cautivando el paladar de quienes la visita.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nancy, tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es operador de maquinaria pesada, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Nancy se dedica a su hogar y a la cría cerdos y cuyes, también cuando le llaman se dedica a cultivar terrenos ajenos, estas actividades las realiza desde que se caso.

Es socia de la banca comunal desde hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes y alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
The “La Estancia” communal bank is composed of 8 members who work in the fields, raise animals and many are merchants.  These activities give them the opportunity to cover their and their households’ expenses.  They are kind, nice and charismatic preserving the culture and traditions of their peoples.  They live throughout Paute Canton, a place that enjoys a temperate climate with land that’s apt for growing flowers.  This canton is the greatest producer of flowers and fruit and also has several places to visit and a varied cuisine that pleases the palates of all who visit.

One of the members of this group is Nancy, 31.  She’s married and has two children who are 8 and 6 years old attending the local elementary school.   Her husband is a heavy machinery operator and the house they live in is their property.

Nancy tends to her home and also raises pigs and guinea pigs and when she’s called to do so works cultivating farmland for others; she’s been doing these activities since she got married.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 6 years and will use her new loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs and feed for them.  Her goal is to continue growing in the business of animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Napoleón

texts.es:
El señor Napoleón tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, pero todos ellos han formado su propio hogar. Él se dedica desde hace más de 40 años a la agricultura, la cual a sido su fuente de ingreso para él y su familia. Este trabajo fue heredado de sus antepasados que le inculcaron esas labores de sembrar maíz, maicillo, entre otros. 

Don Napoleón solicita un financiamiento para comenzar a preparar la tierra, ya que el invierno esta próximo en llegar, según pronósticos meteorológicos faltan aproximadamente 20 días, por esta razón él desea comenzar a preparar la tierra y a su vez el arrendamiento de esta para la producción de granos básicos.

El comprara con el préstamo semilla mejorada, fertilizantes, abono, control de plagas y malezas, pago de arrendamiento de la tierra, entre otros. Para sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y maicillo, con la producción que obtenga tendrá granos para su consumo y para la venta.

Entre los planes de don Napoleón esta el comprar un silo metálico, para el almacenamiento de la cosecha, mejorar las cercas de sus terrenos ya que están dañadas cambiarles los postes, alambres y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 60 years old, and is married with three grown children. He has worked as a farmer for more than 40 years, which has allowed him to provide for his family. He inherited this job from his forefathers, and has learned over the years how best to plant and grow corn and sorghum, among other crops.

Napoleón is requesting this loan to help with the preparation of his land for planting, since winter is coming soon, perhaps within in the next couple weeks. Because of this, he wants to begin getting the land ready, and also wants to make rent payments.

With the support from the loan, he plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides and herbicides, etc. With plantings of 21,000 square meters of corn and sorghum, he should obtain enough production to have grain for his own consumption and for sale.

Some of Napoleón’s future plans include purchasing a metal silo for storing his harvests, improving damages on his lands, changing the poles and wire for his fences, and doing repairs on his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides and herbicides, and to pay the lease on his land, etc.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is a 58-year-old married mom of 2 children. She is living in Lupagan, Clarin, where her wide array of rice production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 20 years of age until the present time. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Ester goes for it. She normally receives 7,846 PHP a month. Earlier in 2011, Ester joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets realized, the revenue from it will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 54 years old and married with 3 children. With 2 children in school, Juanita works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 38 years old and married with 4 children.

Narcisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Narcisa has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Narcisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and for his driver's license paperwork.

loans.name: Las Orquideas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Orquídeas está formado por 6 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por un hermoso sector de  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza natural y colonial la que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos la que le dan el nombre de  Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias y socios son personas trabajadoras quienes con sus labores del día a día, ayudan a mejorar la económicas de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, son muy amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila Teresa, tiene 65 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Zoila Teresa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la casa cría de pollos, conejos y cuyes, tiene este negocio desde hace 10 años.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es comprar más animales para seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank, “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) is made up of six women and two men who all live in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for it cold climate and its natural and colonial beauty, as it has been a UN World Heritage Site since December of 1999. There are four principal rivers that flow through the city, and they give the name Santa Ana of the four rivers to the area. The people of Cuenca still practice and maintain the cultural traditions of their ancestors. 

The members of the community bank are all hardworking, kindhearted people who dedicate themselves to providing for their families. One of the group members is Zoila Teresa, who is 65 years old, and is married with seven grown children, who are also married and live with their spouses and families. Her husband is a bus driver, and they live in a rented home.

Zoila Teresa spends most of her time taking care of the household chores, and she also raises chickens, rabbits and guinea pigs and sells them from her home. She has had this business for ten years.

She is requesting her second loan with the community bank in order to invest in purchasing chickens. Her goal is to buy more animals to keep growing her business

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, son su adoración y su razón para vivir, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, además de ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo por su riquísima sazón para la preparación de platillos típicos. Pablo disfruta de compartir con su familia algunos paseos sobre todo cuando dispone de un tiempo libre así como también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración.

Con mucho entusiasmo Pablo sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi; el se dedica alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque maneja con prudencia y los clientes se sienten seguros cuando toman sus servicios.

Pablo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, comprar llantas y mejorar los asientos; con esta mejora podrá ofrecer mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Construir su casa de material noble ya que cuando sucedió el terremoto del 2007 se derrumbo”.
texts.en:
Pablo is a hardworking and enthusiastic gentleman. He and his partner have two children, ages 11 and 4, who he adores and are his reason for living. Their home is located in the city of Chincha, which is known for its warm climate and beautiful beaches. This area is also the site of the greatest Peruvian sports victories. The traditional dishes that are prepared here are known everywhere for its rich flavor. When he has free time, Pablo enjoys going on trips with his family and spending time with them. He also likes to eat one of Peru's most flavorful dishes, "ceviche" (marinated seafood). Due to his parents' limited financial resources, Pablo was only able to complete high school. He would have liked to go on to study Management.

With great enthusiasm, Pablo leaves for his job as a motorcycle taxi driver. He works approximately 12 hours a day and is able to serve up to 40 customers within that period of time. He believes he has done well in his business because he manages it carefully. His customers feel secure whenever they take advantage of his services.

Pablo is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they will provide, he will be able to provide general maintenance for his vehicle. Pablo will also buy tires and repair the seats. With these improvements, Pablo will be able to offer a better quality of service to his customers. This will improve his income. Pablo strives day after day to achieve his greatest dream of building a house of solid materials. His previous home collapsed in the 2007 earthquake.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance, to buy tires, and to repair the seats of his vehicle.

loans.name: Ezequiel Roberto

texts.es:
Ezequiel es un hombre muy responsable sobre todo porque tiene una familia al lado y por ellos da la vida y se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante; junto a su esposa tienen un pequeño de 7 años, al que quiere mucho y le saca canas verdes ya que es muy juguetón y travieso propios de su edad. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad con un clima caluroso, rodeado de valles donde se realiza la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva, también se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina el cual es un oasis rodeado por dunas hermosas y sobre todo por la amabilidad de sus pobladores.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ezequiel trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en su vivienda, el se dedica alrededor de 8 horas diarias  y atiende hasta 20 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque sus clientes lo conocen y es muy amable en la atención.

Ezequiel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, como arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, conservas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá esforzándose por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is a very responsible man above all because he has a family by his side and he’d give his life for them.  He strives mightily to get ahead alongside his wife and seven year old son who he loves very much even though he makes his hair turn gray because he’s so playful and mischievous, typical of his age.

His house is located in the city of Ica, a city with a hot climate surrounded by agricultural valleys where especially cotton, asparagus and grapes are grown.  The Huacachina Lagoon is also there which is an oasis surrounded by beautiful dunes.  Above all, it’s noted for the kindness of its inhabitants.

Ezequiel goes to work with much enthusiasm selling groceries from home.  He spends about 8 hours daily and can tend to up to 20 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because his customers know him and he provides very gracious customer service.

Ezequiel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy more merchandise for his store like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods and preserved goods, among others which will allow him to have a wider variety of products available and to improve his income to continue striving towards attaining his greatest dream: “To build his house out of substantial building materials.”

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Jesus Joaquina

texts.es:
Jesús   es una mujer de 45 años de edad estado civil casada, con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge. La casa está ubicada en el  caserío La Pala distrito de Tambogrande y no cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 90 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Jesús  es la crianza y venta  de ganado vacuno y animales menores (caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 06 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en la parte exterior de su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, así mismo su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la que tiene sembrado cultivo de mango, limón y cacao en producción; es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 4000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de una moto furgón que le necesita para transportar sus productos al mercado local  y realizar mejoras de sus corrales, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 45 year-old woman who is married and has 3 children in her care.  She lives in her own house with her husband.  Her house is located in the rural La Pala settlement in Tambogrande district, and does not have electricity.  This is a small community that contains about 90 families.

Jesus has a business raising and selling cattle and small animals (goats, pigs and poultry).  She raises them until they are the right size and weight to sell in the local market.  She has been doing this type of work for about 6 years.  Her business is located in back of her house, and she learned this trade from her parents.  In addition, her husband is a farmer who cultivates mangoes, lemons and cocoa on his own land.  He is an excellent farmer, and this allows him to obtain extra income.  She is requesting a loan of 4,000 Peruvian soles.  This money will be used to invest in the purchase of a motorcycle with an attached truck bed that she needs to  transport her products to the market, and she will also use the loan to make some improvements to her animal pens.  This will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with an attached truck bed to transport her products.

loans.name: Norma Gladis

texts.es: En el municipio de Telica en un poblado del  departamento de león, la señora Norma se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Responsable de insumos médicos en un centro de salud de la localidad,   dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 22 años, es casada con 2 hijos   a su cargo a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, Una de las necesidades que la señora Norma   atraviesa es de Mejorar su vivienda, como es el mejoramiento de un Cuarto, El que necesita un mejoramiento para tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida para su familia, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Cemento , Pintura y Mano de Obra para poder realizar dicha mejora en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: In the municipality of Telica, a town in the department of Leon, Norma works arduously in her job managing medical supplies in a health center in the town.  She has been doing this work for 22 years.  She is married and has 2 children in her care, to whom she must provide the conditions needed for their growth and development.  One of Norma's needs is to improve her house.  She needs to improve one of her rooms so that she can have better living conditions for her family.  For this reason, she decided to visit CEPRODEL to request a loan.  This loan will pay for construction costs, including cement, paint and labor, so that she can carry out this project for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to pay for cement, paint, and labor so that she can make improvements to a room in her house

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Panta-on, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Lilia is married and has three children. To make a living, Lilia manages a banana production business. She has been in her business for six years and earns PHP 7,000 a month for these activities. 

Earlier this year, Lilia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which will be used to buy farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more home products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Dolores owns and operates a farm land, where she plants and harvests vegetables for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for nine years. She earns PHP 7,000 per month from this type of business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Dolores has been a member of GDMPC since 2006 and wants to support her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old and married with four children.She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items for her sari-sari store.

Evelyn has borrowed and successfully paid back 14 previous loans taken from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 24 years, and she also earns income from tricycle transportation.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has owns a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell at her general store. Evelyn has been in this business for seven years, and she also earns money from food vending.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 60 years old and married with three children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Estrella has borrowed and paid fourteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for fourteen years and also earns an income from raising livestock and running a carinderia (mini-restaurant or food booth).

Estrella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 39, is married and resides with his wife and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in fishing for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. His wife helps him run the business. Two of his children are employed in a restaurant. They earn about USD 10 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with his family’s transportation, Kong is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable him to use the saved money on his transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income for the family and help his children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 29 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Flordelisa runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods and other beverages to sell .

Flordelisa has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns income from clothing sales. Flordelisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods and other beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Lucia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lucia has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from fishing. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Levita Gina

texts.en:
Levita Gina has a junk shop business, buying and selling scrap materials such as cans, bottles, plastics, jars, and metals to resell at a higher price. This way Levita Gina and her spouse generate income for living. 

Though they only generate minimal income from the business, they are still happy to provide sustenance for the family. She would like to increase their income, but she has insufficient funds. So now she is asking for PHP 45,000 to buy more bottles, empty cans, and metals to re-sell for profit. 

Someday, Levita Gina and her spouse would like to keep improving their small business for the overall welfare of the family. She also hopes to give the best education to their children, so that they can earn degrees and have better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy more bottles, empty cans, and metals to re-sell for profit.

loans.name: Santos Alexis

texts.es:
El señor Santos tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él se dedica desde hace 18 años a sembrar y vender hortalizas, siempre ha trabajado en este negocio,  pero desde hace 6 años trabaja más duro, su vida siempre ha sido en el campo.  

Él compra los insumos para sus cultivos en una ciudad del oriente del país, como son los fertilizantes, venenos y la planta la cual le esta generando sus productos. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más fertilizantes ya que tiene un lote grande de pepino, ejotes y necesita abonos, mano de obra. Además tiene una parte para sembrar maíz y para esta necesita comprar todos los insumos.

Con el financiamiento Santos dispondrá de capital de trabajo, para realizar sus actividades ya que son el sustento de su familia. También, dispondrá del maíz y las verduras para venderlas en la  temporada y obtener ingresos mayores.

Él piensa heredarles a sus hijos la tierra donde trabaja que es propia y la cual espera que continúen con su legado y desea proveer en grandes cantidades a los supermercados con sus verduras y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He has been growing and selling vegetables for 18 years. Santos has always been in this business, but he has had to work extremely hard the past six years. He has spent his entire life in the field.

Santos buys his supplies, such as fertilizers and chemicals, at a city in the eastern part of the country. These supplies help him grow his products. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more fertilizers since he has a large plot of cucumbers and green beans that are in need of compost and labor. He also has a section where he grows corn, so he needs to buy supplies for that crop.

This loan will provide Santos with available operating capital to conduct his business activities so that he can sustain his family. As a result, he will have available corn and vegetables to sell for this season so that he can earn more income.

Santos plans to leave his land to his children so that they will have their own source of work. He hopes that they will continue his legacy. Santos wants to provide large quantities of vegetables and produce to supermarkets.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farming supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Vilma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years, and also earns income from making and selling dried fish.

Vilma aspires to save enough to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Beverly Gil

texts.en: This time, Beverly Gil is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her dried fish business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, which is helping Beverly and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es: María nació en La Mana provincia de Cotopaxi. Tiene 39 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo es chofer de un tricimoto, realiza fletes y le va bien ya que en su ciudad es común este tipo de vehículos para el transporte diario. Sus hijos asisten al colegio fiscal, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad y no se encuentra a su cargo. Inicio su negocio hace varios años vendiendo legumbres en el centro de La Mana, trabaja desde las 6 am hasta las 19 pm. María nos cuenta que su trabajo se dificulta en las vacaciones escolares  y el invierno por las enfermedades. El préstamo la desea para aumentar su negocio comprando víveres: cebollas, papa, choclo en sacos. Desea aumentar sus ventas para poder solicitar un crédito más grande para arreglar su casa, quiere hacer cuartos de arriendo para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
María was born in La Mana in the province of Cotopaxi. She is 39 years old, is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a motorbike chauffeur. He provides transportation and it is going well for him now that in his city this type of vehicle is common for daily transportation.  Their children attend public school. One of them is now an adult and is not in their charge.  

She started her business several years ago selling vegetables in the center of La Mana. She works from 6 am until 7 pm. María tells us that her work is more difficult during school breaks, and in the winter due to illness. She wants the loan to grow her business by buying supplies: sacks of onions, potatoes and corn. She wants to increase her sales to be able to request a bigger loan to fix her house. She wants to make rentable rooms to improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions, potatoes and corn

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre  femmes du groupe Balimaya ont  en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de SAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  condiments alimentaires et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  2 eme   prêt solidaire.
Madame, SALI (première  femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de pâte  alimentaire. Elle est très sollicitée dans son quartier. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 40 seaux de pâte d’arachide  elle s’approvisionne auprès des sœurs à l’église catholique. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Sali   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer et au remboursement correcte du prêt Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Balimaya group are all married women living in traditional extended families and averaging 33 years of age, with four children. They all live in the town of San in the Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors and relatives. They buy and resell food condiments and miscellaneous items.

With the goal of bolstering their work capital, the group members have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and are now on their 2nd solidarity loan. Mrs. Sali (the first one standing on the right in the photo) successfully sells corn meal mash. Her business is very popular in the neighborhood.

She plans to use her loan to buy 40 pails of peanut paste. She buys from nuns at the local Catholic church. She retails for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women.

With this loan, Mrs. Sali plans to achieve an average monthly income of 15,000 West African Francs, which will be used to reinvest in the business and to help her husband with family expenses, as well as to repay Soro Yiriwaso’s loan in a proper fashion.

loans.use: to buy peanut paste.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Sothy, 34, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than ten years. She is involved in growing crops and fattening up animals. Sothy has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She earns about $9 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sothy is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to pay for her black pepper cultivation. This money will help her expand her pepper plantation and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her child get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for her black pepper cultivation.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou owns a store selling grocery items, fruits, and vegetables to her customers at Estefania. She is married and has two children. Marilou usually earns about 4,000 PHP monthly, which goes for meals, allowances, and other expenses for the family. Marilou would like to improve her sales, so she is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy biscuits, eggs, sardines, noodles, and fruits to sell in her store.

In the future, Marilou would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and save funds for her children's education; she hopes this will be the legacy she passes on to her children.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, eggs, sardines, noodles, and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has been running a small store in her house at Estefania for almost four years. She is married and has two young children who are in elementary school. Janet is married to a tricycle (motorcycle) driver. They both generate income for the family. Janet is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy sardines, eggs, milk, coffee, and biscuits to sell. She would like to ensure good costumer service and affordable prices for her loving customers. 

Someday, Janet hopes to make her business more profitable and achieve better way of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, milk, coffee, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia lives at Pussian, Alcala in the province of Cagayan (Philippines). To make a living, she sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. Her spouse is a carpenter. Together, they are raising five children. Patricia has been selling fruits and vegetables for over five years now. She would like to improve her sales, so she is asking for additional capital of 12,000 PHP in order to buy cabbage, eggplant, string beans, and bananas to sell. Someday, she hopes to keep improving her sales and meet her customers demand for affordable prices. She hopes this will improve her income from the business. Patricia also hopes to renovate their small house.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant, string beans and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn is an industrious woman. She is a single mother who lives with her parents at Pussian. Maylyn manages a small store which sells grocery items to the people in their village. She usually earns about 5,000 PHP each month from these activities. She is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy shampoo, toothpaste, biscuits, canned goods, and sardines to sell in her store. Additional merchandise will help increase her sales and earnings. 

In the future, Maylyn would like to earn good profits from the business and develop it to achieve progress for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, biscuits, canned goods, and sardines to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives peacefully at Pussian with her spouse and three children. To add to her spouse's income from farming, she makes and sells yema, tamarind, and ube (purple yam) candies to earn profits. She usually earns about 3,000 PHP monthly. Now, she would like to borrow a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy plastic wrappers, skimmed milk, flour, and eggs to use in her food production business. She hopes to diversify the business and make consistent profits from it. With good profits from the business, Evelyn would like to continuously provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic wrappers, skimmed milk, flour, and eggs to use in her food production business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome runs a store selling grocery items to the people in her locale. She has been operating her business for seven years. She is 47 years old and a widower with three children; the youngest is currently in high school. Salome is borrowing a loan of 8,000 PHP to add to her capital in order to buy sardines, eggs, breads, and biscuits to sell in her store. This will help increase her sales and income too. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, breads, and biscuits to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Tol, 21, is single and resides with his parents in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been employed in a massage shop for more than three years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His parents are farmers who earn about USD 6 per day. Due to his family’s transportation difficulties, Tol is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help him reduce his family’s transportation expenses. In the future, he would like to run a new business related to animal husbandry in order to earn more income to support his family, and rebuild his present house to make it bigger and more convenient.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his commute.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa lives at Bugallon Proper Ramon (Philippines) with her spouse and two children. She devotes her full time to running her food-retail business. Elisa offers fish sauce, homemade candies and other sweets from Pangasinan. She acquires her products once a week at Pangasinan through her three delivery helpers. 

Elisa has had this kind of business for more than 11 years. Within that period of time, she has experienced ups and downs due to uncollected credit when some of her customers migrated to other places. Despite her situation, Elisa still hopes that she can overcome the trials in life. So she has decided to borrow additional working capital from lenders amounting to 50,000 PHP, allowing her to buy stock of fish sauce and candies for her business. She believes that through this amount, she could obtain success in life and be able to put her children through higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish sauce and candies for her food production business.

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Lualhati's business for almost nine years. She is 36 years of age and married to Roger, who is a Nestle salesman. She is happy because they have one child who is currently studying. Her greatest dream in life is to have a better way of living, to educate her only child, and to have a stable source of income.

Lualhati is raising nine piglets at this time. She would like to raise them well and provide their daily feed in order to improve their growth, but her capital is no longer enough due to the abruptly high cost of basic commodities and expensive livestock feeds. For this reason, she is asking for a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP. She hopes that she can get this amount, allowing her to buy vaccines and livestock feeds for her hog-raising business. 

Lualhati believes that she could be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and livestock feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with 2 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 29 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment to repair her fishing boat.

Helen has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Melanie requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.es:
Doña Melecia, esta casada, tiene 47 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposo en su propia casa de habitación junto con sus 4 hijos en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras.
El negocio de Doña Melecia es la venta de tortillas. En su casa de habitación en la zona sur de Honduras, Doña Melecia esta solicitando la cantidad de 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz y leña. De esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio, por lo que sus ingresos serán mejores.
Entre los sueños de Doña Melecia a futuro esta la idea de obtener un crédito mayor para la compra de una maquina de fabricar tortillas, para lograr un incremento en sus ingresos y  dar un mejor estatus de vida a sus hijos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Doña Melecia is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. They reside in the Department of Valle in southern Honduras. Doña Melecia's business involves selling tortillas from her home in the southern part of Honduras.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 so that she can buy corn and firewood. This will help her business generate more sales so that her income will improve. Doña Melecia dreams of obtaining a larger loan in the future so that she can purchase a machine for making tortillas. By doing so, she will be able to increase her income and provide a better living status for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Julia es una emprendedora que ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León, durante el crédito ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, su mayor sueño es de tener su negocio bien surtido de la venta de cosméticos bien surtido para ofrecerle a su negocio una variedad de productos. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar productos como: sabana, toalla, cosméticos, calzado, artículos del hogar entre otros productos.
texts.en: Julia is an entrepreneur who has been working with the León Foundation. During the loan period she has shown herself to be a responsible person with a strong desire to get ahead. Her greatest dream is to have her business well stocked for the sale of cosmetics, so she can offer a variety of products. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy products such as sheets, towels, cosmetics, shoes and household goods, among other products.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, cosmetics, shoes and household products, among others.

loans.name: Reynalin

texts.en:
Reynalin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari store for her sari-sari store business.

Reynalin has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from clothing sales and raising carabao.

Reynalin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Daninova

texts.en:
Daninova is 64 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Daninova runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

Daninova has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Daninova would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old and a widow with 3 children. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is married with 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Inocencia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her business.

Inocencia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La  señora María es originaria de un poblado del departamento de león, su profesión es maestra de educación Primaria, actualmente está impartiendo clases en el colegio de la zona de larreynaga de la que tiene  5 años de ejercer dicha actividad, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por  1 hijo,  el que estudia en el colegio de la localidad, también es madre soltera, actualmente solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda con la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Bloques, Zinc, Hierro y Mano de Obra. Para mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para continuar solicitando financiamiento y cumplir con su sueño, ya que los créditos recibidos le han sido de gran impacto en mejoramiento mismo de ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
María is a native of a town in the Department of León. She is a primary school teacher; currently, she is teaching classes at a school in the Larreynaga area. She has 5 years of experience doing this.

Her family consists of 1 son who studies at a local school. She is also a single mother. She is requesting this loan in order to improve her house with the purchase of construction materials, such as cement, blocks, metal roofing, and also labor. 

In order to better her conditions and standard of living, she approached CEPRODEL to ask for funding and fulfill her dream, since the loans she has received have had a great impact on self-improvement for herself and her son.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as: cement, blocks, metal roofing, iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
