Emelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her fruit vending business.

Emelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from vegetable retail.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon, 59, is widowed and resides with five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about USD 14 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sokhon is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a squeezing machine to run the business of selling sugarcane juice. This purchase will help her generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a squeezing machine to run the business of selling sugarcane juice

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Felipa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her furniture shop.

Felipa has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Felipa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for her furniture shop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 47 years old and married with 5 children.

Francisca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store.

Francisca has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Francisca aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is married with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Gorgonia has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Gorgonia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Imelda has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from billiard table rental.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has been running her rolling store for four years. She uses her motorcycle as transport in selling her products. With her aim to improve their way of living and have a stable source of income, Teresa patiently runs her business and economizes in her household expenditures. In this way, she can cover all their daily expenses and support her children's education.

To make her dreams possible, Teresa is asking for bigger financial support from ASKI and KIVA. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to buy vegetables, raw pork meat, fish, frozen foods and other basic needs for her food production business. She knows that through this small business she manages, she will succeed. So,Teresa is hoping that her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, raw pork meat, fish, frozen foods and other basic needs for her food production business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has been a hog raiser for more than five years. She is happily married to Reynaldo.The couple is blessed with five grown up children. Three of the children have settled for marriage while the other two are still single. Her youngest child is still studying.

Gloria is raising one sow and 12 for fattening. With the number of hogs being fattened, she is in need of more capital..So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to buy livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a food selling shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 15,000,  she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Carolyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Carolyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joyce runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Joyce has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, noodles, snack food, etc.

In the future Joyce would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a widow and a mother of three children aged 23, 20 and 13. She has been actively farming for ten years. Her farm produces paw paw and vegetables, which she sells in the local market. She gets additional income from her pension.

Jane has requested a loan of 45,000 KES which she plans to invest in her massive banana farming. She also plans to start rearing high quality breeds of dairy cows in order to gain financial security and educate her last born child.

Jane laments about the low water supply which compels farmers to install irrigation systems together with animal diseases which reduce their output and occasionally lead to their eventual death.

loans.use: To expand her banana plantation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, who has 5 children, is separated from her husband. She is 42 years old, and resides at Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maria cultivates a garden area where she plants vegetables for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Maria wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 65 years old and a widow with 7 children.

Julita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Julita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice, charcoal and vegetables.

Julita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Eden Joy

texts.en:
Eden Joy works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Eden Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Eden Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice buying and selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Lourdes has been in this business for 20 years, and she also earns income from buying and selling handicraft products.

Lourdes has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marìa Vanessa

texts.es:
María  es una mujer de 29 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el caserío La Ladrillera   distrito de Cayalti y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una ciudad de aproximadamente 800 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla María es  la venta de productos de belleza, además de gelatinas, chupetes, marcianos y los comercializa en una parte de su domicilio donde atiende todos los días de la semana. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 03 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge percibe ingresos como agricultor ya que  siembra sus cultivos  y también le apoya en la canasta familiar.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza  y poder atender a sus clientes en esta zona, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 29-year-old woman who is in a common-law relationship and has three dependent children. She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which is located in the village of La Ladrillera in the District of Cayalti. They receive electricity services. This place is a city with approximately 800 families.

María has a business of selling beauty products. She also offers gelatin, popsicles, and frozen milk treats for sale in a section of her home that she manages every day of the week. María has been in business for approximately three years. She learned this trade from her parents and is known for being a perfectionist in her work. To complement her business, her husband generates income as a farmer by growing his crops. They help one another with the family expenses.

The loan amount of 1,500 PEN that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beauty products. This will enable her to serve her customers in the area so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Lanie Rose

texts.en: Lanie Rose is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old. Lanie Rose is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lanie Rose owns and operates a motorcycle transport service, ie a single motorcycle with a passenger. Lanie Rose has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Lanie Rose is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a motorcycle sidecar (motor cab). In 2008, Lanie Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lanie Rose's future plan is to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle sidecar (motor cab)

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 25 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soft drinks, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, Jocel would like to save enough to improve her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is borrowing PHP 22,000 to fund her abaca weaving business. This business was previously funded through NWTFand KIVA. It continues to provide Luisa and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials used in her abaca business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 41 years old and married with four children. With all her children in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, detergent, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a used clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell. Lucilyn has been in this business for 6 years, and she earns extra income from buying and selling jewelry.

Lucilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell.
